<p>
<a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?city=saratoga" rel="city">Saratoga</a> July 3Oth <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?year=1779">1779</a> 
</p><p>
Dear Sir 
</p><p>
Yesterday I was honored with a line from our Amiable General advising me of the reduction of <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?city=stoney point" rel="place">Stoney Point</a> and dwelling on the propriety and 
Bravery with which It was Executed. It was not the least part of my satisfaction to hear that You Conducted It And I most Sincerely Congratulate you on the Increase of honor you have Acquired, Such of the Enemy as have hitherto 
held Erroneous Ideas of the Military prowess of our troops must now be perfectly Convinced of their mistake. 
</p><p>
Pray make not my Compliments only but my Love to S Clair and do you and he continue Yours For that Great good man to whom we are so much Indebted 
</p><p>
Remember me to Your family In which I Include those I have been happy with at Your Quarters 
</p><p>
adieu 
</p><p>
I am Dear Sir 
</p><p>
Most Sincerely Your 
</p><p>
Obedient Servant 
</p><p>
<a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?tla=pjs" rel="me">P SCHUYLER</a> 
</p><p>
A Slight remains of an Indisposition prevents me from a visit to the Army I hope however soon to have the pleasure of seeing You 
</p><p>
BR: <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?tla=atw" rel="colleague">GEN. WAYNE</a>. 
</p>
